metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1638 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Heap buffer overflow in V8 Internationalization in Google Chrome prior to101.0.4951.64 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heapcorruption via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1638` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 101.0.4951.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 101.0.4951.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 101.0.4951.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 101.0.4951.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 101.0.4951.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '101.0.4951.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
